gw.api.domain.invoice

Class DateSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.domain.invoice.DateSequence
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoundedDateSequence, CompositeDateSequence, NudgedDateSequence, PeriodicDateSequence, ShiftedDateSequence

    public abstract class DateSequence
extends java.lang.Object
    A DateSequence is an ordered list of dates. The dates are not necessarily contiguous -- they can be any set of dates.

      • datesInInterval

        public abstract java.util.SortedSet<org.joda.time.DateTime> datesInInterval(org.joda.time.Interval dateInterval)
        Returns all of the dates from this sequence that are within the given interval.
        Parameters:
        dateInterval - the interval to use (inclusive on start, exclusive on the end)
        Returns:
        a sorted set of dates. If no dates are within the interval, the set will be EMPTY.

      • numberOfDatesIn

        public int numberOfDatesIn(org.joda.time.Interval dateInterval)
        Returns the number of Dates from this sequence that are in the given interval.
        Parameters:
        dateInterval - the interval to use (inclusive on start, exclusive on the end)
        Returns:
        0 if there are no dates from this sequence in the interval, otherwise it will be a positive int.

      • boundedBy

        public BoundedDateSequence boundedBy(org.joda.time.Interval interval)
        Creates a date sequence that takes the current sequence and bounds (constrains) it by the given interval. This is typically used to constrain a date sequence to be within a particular window of time.
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval used as the bounds for the new date sequence
        Returns:
        a new date sequence bounded by the given interval.

      • combinedWith

        public DateSequence combinedWith(DateSequence otherDateSequence)
        Creates a date sequence that is the combination of this date sequence and another date sequence. The new date sequence contains all the dates that are in either this sequence or the other date sequence, without duplicates.
        Parameters:
        otherDateSequence - the other date sequence to combine with this date sequence
        Returns:
        a new date sequence that is the combination of this date sequence and otherDateSequence

      • createPeriodicSequenceWith

        public static DateSequence createPeriodicSequenceWith(Periodicity periodicity,
                                      org.joda.time.DateTime... anchorDates)
        Creates a date sequence that contains the anchor date and that has the given periodicity. It calls the IDateSequence plugin, which can be configured to return a different date sequence than the default.
        Parameters:
        periodicity - how often the dates in the sequence occur -- monthly, weekly, etc.
        anchorDates - one or more dates that are in the sequence. This determines the day of month for monthly sequences, the days of month for twice-per-month sequences, the day of week for weekly sequences, and a particular day that is in the sequence for every other week sequences. If the periodicity is twice-per-month and there is only one anchor date supplied, the second anchor date will be half a month from the given anchor date.
        Returns:
        a new sequence that fulfills the periodicity and anchor date requirements

      • createPeriodicSequenceWith

        public static DateSequence createPeriodicSequenceWith(Periodicity periodicity,
                                      java.util.Date... anchorDates)
        Creates a date sequence that contains the anchor date and that has the given periodicity. It calls the IDateSequence plugin, which can be configured to return a different date sequence than the default.
        Parameters:
        periodicity - how often the dates in the sequence occur -- monthly, weekly, etc.
        anchorDates - one or more dates that are in the sequence. This determines the day of month for monthly sequences, the days of month for twice-per-month sequences, the day of week for weekly sequences, and a particular day that is in the sequence for every other week sequences. If the periodicity is twice-per-month and there is only one anchor date supplied, the second anchor date will be half a month from the given anchor date.
        Returns:
        a new sequence that fulfills the periodicity and anchor date requirements

      • shiftedLaterBy

        public DateSequence shiftedLaterBy(int days)
        Shifts this date sequence by the specified number of days. Returns this date sequence if the number of days is zero.
        Parameters:
        days - number of days to shift sequence by
        Returns:
        a new ShiftedDateSequence shifted by the specified number of days

      • shiftedEarlierBy

        public DateSequence shiftedEarlierBy(int days)
        Shifts this date sequence earlier by the given number of days
        Parameters:
        days - number of days to shift by
        Returns:
        a new ShiftedDateSequence shifted earlier by the given number of days

                    DateNudger dateNudger)
        Moves this date sequence as specified by the given DateNudger
        Parameters:
